titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the UH Women's Organizations

titlepage.titleproper: Guide to the UH Women's Organizations 1962/1994

did.head: Overview of the Collection

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Special Collections, University of Houston Libraries

did.abstract: The University of Houston Women's Association Collection contain records of the organization from its founding in 1962 through 1994. The bulk of the materials date from the 1980s. Most of the UHWA papers consist of paper documents, with a few photographs.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information:
bioghist.p: The Faculty Wives Club and the Woman's Club of the University of Houston combined in 1962 to form the University of Houston Women's Association (UHWA). The UHWA provided a social and service organization for the wives of faculty and staff, and an ever-increasing number of female university faculty. Throughout each academic year the UHWA arranged various large-scale activities such as swimming parties, dinner theaters, and dances for its members, of which numbers usually ranged from two to three hundred dues-paying members. Smaller interest-based group functions included bridge games, book clubs, sewing parties, and gourmet cooking lessons. The organization also supported the student population through service events. The most notable of these is the Mary Harding Hoffman scholarship established in 1978. The scholarship provided children of University of Houston faculty or staff with tuition for their freshman year at the University of Houston on a merit basis.

An annually-elected executive board of officers led the University of Houston Women’s Association. The primary officers, consisting of a President, Vice President, Secretary, and Treasurer directed the affairs of the UHWA through smaller committees. The most consistently active committees during the organization's history included the newcomers, scholarship, and activities committees. The activities group also subdivided into smaller units gathering members with similar interests such as bridge, sewing, reading, and bowling.

controlaccess.p: This Collection is indexed under the following controlled access subject terms.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use:
userestrict.p: Special Collections owns the physical items in our collections, but copyright normally belongs to the creator of the materials or their heirs. The researcher has full responsibility for determining copyright status, locating copyright holders, and abiding by current copyright laws when publishing or displaying copies of Special Collections material in print or electronic form. For more information, consult the appropriate librarian.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation:
prefercite.p: UH Women's Organizations, Courtesy of Special Collections, University of Houston Libraries

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The University of Houston Women's Association Collection contain records of the organization from its founding in 1962 through 1994. The bulk of the materials date from the 1980s. Most of the UHWA papers consist of paper documents, with a few photographs. The collection is arranged chronologically within each series, adhering as much as possible to the original order. However, the organizations of some items varied with the majority of the material, resulting in slight reordering. Materials regarding the Faculty Wives' Club, the Women's Club of the University of Houston, and the American Association of University Women, initially found among the UHWA documents, were removed and arranged in separate collections. The researcher may find it helpful to examine these smaller collections as well as the University of Houston Women's Association Papers.

The twelve series of the UHWA papers each follow the chronological order of the overall collection. The series are: the Executive Board, Business Meeting Minutes, Financial Records, Mary H. Hoffman Scholarship, Membership, Publicity, Activities, Newsletters, Correspondence, Photographs, Yearbooks, and Miscellaneous.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: There are twenty-three folders in this series which contain the UHWA’s administrative guidelines and by-laws. Also included are lists of executive board members, executive board meeting agendas and minutes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: There are six folders in this series. The majority of minutes record events of the UHWA's Fall and Spring business meetings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: There are thirty-five folders in this series. The financial records series contains budgets, bank statements, treasurer's reports, books of check stubs, and receipts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: There are thirteen folders in this series which contains information about the Mary Hoffman Scholarship from its founding in 1978 through 1994. The series is particularly strong in documenting the establishment of the scholarship, including initial fund-raising efforts. Financial records for the scholarship are separate from those dealing with the general financial affairs of the University of Houston Women's Association.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: There are eleven folders in this series. The series includes lists of members as well as new faculty and staff lists which the newcomer committee used to recruit members. Box 4, Folder 7 contains a black, leather-bound ledger dating from 1950-1973, containing lists of dues-paying members as well as the amount paid. This item predates the UHWA but is labeled “UH Women's Association Membership 1950-1973,” and therefore is filed with this organization’s membership files. There is also a miscellaneous sub-division in this series. The miscellaneous folder contains registration forms, advertising flyers, and listings of important Houston-area organizations, emergency services, and events.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: There are seven folders in this series which include press releases from the 1960s, 1970s, and early 1980s. The series also contains newspaper clippings from various Houston-area newspapers as well as University of Houston system and campus publications.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: There are fourteen folders in this series which consists of programs and information regarding the various activities, calendars of events, and reports written by members evaluating the different activities.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: There are thirty-one folders in this series containing a fairly complete set of monthly or bi-monthly UHWA newsletters from the first edition in late 1962 through March 1994. The newsletters are arranged by academic year. Most of the issues are present with the exception of a few missing monthly editions and the partial academic years of 1974/75, 1975/76, 1976/77, and 1977/78.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: There are thirteen folders in this series. Formal correspondence, comprised mostly of letters received by the organization, date from 1961 through 1992. Informal correspondence includes a large number of thank you and sympathy cards of various dates, with the majority dated during the 1970s.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: There are six folders in this series. The photographs contain both color snapshots and some black and white pictures.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: There are eleven folders in this series. Yearbooks include a listing of the UHWA's constitution, a complete roster of members (including telephone numbers, department or spouse’s department, and address), and a variety of other information, depending on the year. Each yearbook encompasses an academic year and ranges from 1962-1963 through 1993-1994, excluding the school years of: 1971/72, 1972/73, 1974/75, 1980/81, 1984/85 through 1987/88, and 1992/93.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains four folders of material. Contents of the folders include items such as: Internal Revenue Service tax identification number forms, bulk mail rate applications, an announcement from a basketball game about the UHWA and the Mary H. Hoffman Scholarship, various surveys and invitations, and undated, handwritten notes. Also included in the grouping is a spiral notebook labeled “President's Report”. The notebook contains UHWA Presidents’ comments on the organization’s activities from 1968-1972, as well as some newspaper clippings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials in the binders consist of the same types of materials found in other series, but are being kept in original order in Series 13.
